name: Dow Villa Motel

reviews.text: This was our second winter stay at the Dow Villa Motel, and we have no reason to stay anywhere else.
reviews.title: Great value; friendly service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Dow Villa Motel is an excellent value. The rooms are above average for a motel in that they have TVs with DVD players, a refrigerator, microwave, hair dryer, and toiletries provided. It certainly cuts down on the amount of items to pack in one's luggage. It's nice to have a room where one can relax to watch a movie and eat microwave popcorn (especially those of us with preteen children). Our room with two queen beds was both clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: Much better than expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom of our room looked newly retiled and wallpapered, and hot water came quickly through the sink and shower faucets. That may not sound like much, but it sure helps when one has just come in from the snow or cold wind.
reviews.title: Nice place--Soft Beds

reviews.text: It is hard to beat the location for convenience, also. There are restaurants on either side (High Sierra Cafe next door to the south and the more upscale Seasons Restaurant only one block north) and a pizza parlor across the street. Across the street and one block north are a grocery store and bakery.
reviews.title: Just ok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: An improvement over our last stay was the friendliness of the front clerk. Justin was very kind and helpful.
reviews.title: reasonable motel in interesting town

likes.liked: — Lone Pine is in a pretty location
likes.disliked: — old fashioned, dowdy, lacking in comforts

reviews.text: We've stayed here before and we choose the hotel rather than it's attached motel. Although the motel is more modern (and more expensive) we like the olde worlde feel that the hotel building has, even though the rooms are rather small and a little basic. Everything was clean and worked well, although the plumbing is clearly elderly. The hotel has been refurbed and smartened up since our last visit. Helpful staff, charming old film memorabilia in the reception areas, a really nice outdoor pool (well fenced in for kids) and all set against the backdrop of snowcapped Sierra Nevada peaks. Plenty of eateries all around. Excellent value at $60+ per room, and I wish we had longer to stay there.
reviews.title: Characterful hotel in nice township

reviews.text: Delightful for the price. Under $100, pool (open before Memorial day, albeit cold), very nice staff (Craig @ front desk was very accomodating, efficient). Clean.
reviews.title: Excellent for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: A very pleasant surprise!

reviews.text: Nice to have a microwave & fridge in the room w/o asking.
reviews.title: Historic Hotel is neat, but...

reviews.text: Pizza across the street was okay. Salad bar was not worthwhile. Had Sierra Nevada on tap...
reviews.title: Better than expected

reviews.text: Excellent clean rooms, that have a good sized refrigerator, a microwave,video and dvd player, and comfortable beds. Very clean and quiet. Nice lobby , lounge and patio. Don't expect to spend much time in the pool, as they allow the community children to use it as a plunge. Lots of local kids in the pool with cut-offs and t-shirts. They all leave in the evening, but by then the pool water is very hazy. Motel is great though, and highly recomended!
reviews.title: Great Motel, but don't try using the pool !
A great place to stay
reviews.text: We liked the rooms, quiet and clean. Great views of Mt. Whitney and eat at Seasons a real find!!!

description: Three diamond motel located in the center of town at the base of Mt Whitney. Your stop on the way to Death Valley National Park.
